capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The role requires effective planning and prioritisation to implement and coordinate threatened species projects, often under dynamic conditions.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Problem-solving is essential for adapting to field-based challenges and developing practical solutions for conservation outcomes.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: The role demands accountability through adherence to safety protocols and accurate data collection in independent work settings.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Effective communication skills are crucial for collaborating with a range of stakeholders and reporting on project outcomes.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Collaboration with rangers, field staff, and contractors is key to the successful implementation of threatened species programs.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Strong project management and coordination skills are required to support multiple conservation projects.

skills.name: Ecology
skills.description: Understanding of ecological principles and experience in field-based conservation projects.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Ability to engage and work collaboratively with various stakeholders for conservation efforts.

skills.name: Data Collection and Analysis
skills.description: Skills in accurate data collection and analysis for reporting on project outcomes.

generalRole.name: Conservation Project Officer
generalRole.title: Assistant Project Officer Threatened Species
generalRole.description: This role involves planning, implementing, and monitoring conservation projects with a focus on threatened species, requiring a blend of ecological knowledge, project management, and stakeholder engagement skills.
